A striking example of the image held by WJR in
Detroit hangs on the wall in Mr. Quellofs office. It is a
framed resolution passed in 1950, signed by Detroit's
mayor and city council, endorsing WJR's license renewal
application to the FCC.
Winner of 38 awards since 1959, and this year,
the only radio station to capture the NEA School Bell
Award "for distinguished service in the interpretation of
education", WJR's unique position is reflected in the
spirit and enthusiasm of its employees, as well as its
listeners. WJR personnel have immense pride in their
work and in their station. They are convinced that "WJR's
carefully built image and practices are also those which

ing. "
